knimeNode.name: HDF5 Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Writes groups, dataSets and attributes in an HDF5 File.

fullDescription.intro:
This node writes groups, dataSets and attributes in an HDF5 File. Groups can be created independently from the input. DataSets can be created by using columns of the input table. Attributes can be created by using flow variables. All objects can also be created by copying or modifying existing objects in the output HDF5 File.
Note: Be careful that the output HDF5 File is not open somewhere else on the machine while executing this node! It is only checked in Windows and POSIX-compliant Linux so far!

tab.name: Options

ul.li:
Selected file:
Select the path to the output HDF5 File (file extensions .h5, .hdf5).

Overwrite file:
The option integrate manipulates an existing file.
The option overwrite overwrites an existing file.
The option rename creates a new file with an unused name if the file already exists.

tab.option:
Specifies the configuration of the edits which the node should apply on the output file.
The button Reset config resets the data configuration, i.e. it removes all edits from the data configuration such that no manipulations would be done to the file on an execution (except creating the file itself).
The button Reset invalid edits resets invalid edits in the data configuration. Note that dataSetEdits with invalid columnEdits can only be reset as whole.
The columns from the input table and the flow variables can be copied by drag-and-drop in the output file tree. Similarly, the items of the output file tree can be copied by drag-and-drop.
More options for manipulation of those items can be reached by a right mouse click.
The tooltip of each item shows some information about this item:
data type (if available)
reference to the copy source, i.e. the name of the original column/flow variable or the path of the original item where this item was copied from
invalid cause (if it is invalid)
The edits for groups, dataSets and attributes allow to modify their properties which always include:
name
overwrite policy with the options NONE, IGNORE, OVERWRITE, RENAME, INTEGRATE
Properties for data types (of dataSets/attributes):
type
unsigned
endian
rounding (from double to int)
string length with the options 'auto' (sets the string length to the max. string length in the data) and 'fixed'
Properties only for dataSets:
overwrite policy for new columns with the options 'insert' and 'overwrite' (new columns overwrite their predecessor based on the order of the columns)
(optional) standard value for missing values (or let the column be invalid if this option is not used)
create a dataSet with one dimension: option only available if the dataSet only has one column, otherwise it has two dimensions
(optional) compression
(optional) chunk row size: option only available if option 'compression' is enabled
columns: a list to order the columns using drag-and-drop
Properties only for attributes:
Use values from flowVariable array: option to recover the values of a String flow variable representing an array (imported by the node 'HDF5 Reader')

ul.li:
Save column properties:
Specifies if the node creates for each dataSet, where some columns are modified, two additional attributes with information about the original columns of the input table:
'knime.columnnames' for the names of the columns
'knime.columntypes' for the original data types of the columns

ports.inPort: Optional input table (is not needed for writing attributes).
